meanings.sent1: The room was filled with a niff of rotten eggs.
meanings.sent2: I wrinkled my nose at the niff coming from the garbage can.
meanings.sent3: The niff from the old socks made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The niff of failure hung heavy in the air.
meanings.sent5: The niff of burnt popcorn lingered in the hallway.

meanings.definition: To emit a strong, unpleasant smell.
meanings.sent1: The garbage began to niff after sitting in the sun.
meanings.sent2: The flowers niffed a sweet fragrance in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The cheese niffed so bad that even the mice avoided it.
meanings.sent4: The old books niffed memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The campfire niffed smoke into the night sky.
